poem:
The Elephant Whisperer  

In the jungle's breath,  
chains rattle dreams—  
a girl sees the truth  
within heavy shadows.  
Giant eyes meet her call,  
echoing rumbles of land,  
ancient and tender.  
Her whispers weave freedom,  
a path through whispered leaves,  
untamed, they loom—  
souls unchained by rhythm  
and the soft turn  
of a woman's heart.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The elephant whisperer: one Thai woman’s lifelong quest to protect a rescued herd Saengduean Lek Chailert was five years old when she saw an elephant for the first time. It was in chains, lumbering past her home in rural Thailand on its way to help loggers pull trees from the forest. Back then, she saw the giant mammals like everyone else – as animals that served humans. But that changed the day she heard a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
